title: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
heya hey, long time no post...
just wanted to present these old remade soundtracks i found on my computer. they are three remakes of my favourite soundtracks from Day of The Tentacle! and by remake i mean same composition but with much better sound than midi [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]


[url=http://www.megaupload.com/?d=Z71NY93F]Download them from Megaupload[/url]

i hope they will give some nostalgic feelings to ya [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

[img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/d/d5/Dottscreen.png[/img]
[img]http://obligement.free.fr/gfx/daytentacle-2.jpg[/img]

title: ha!
content: I get off work in an hour; I'll be on these like a hobo on a ham sammich.

title: Re: ha!
content:

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Excellent! How did you do this?[hr][/quote]

used extracted midi data from the game, used soundfonts and samplers for instruments [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]


[quote]Quote:[hr]...It's OGG? :\[hr][/quote]

dude get used to OGG it's the best sound format around! winamp has support for it as default
so you should have no problem playing it.


[quote]Quote:[hr]Is it that good? I've never even played it.. Perhaps I should listen to those.[hr][/quote]

yes, it's a fine game if you like the adventure-click-and-discover genre. lucasart at it's best [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
What's wrong with Ogg Vorbis, besides the obvious nothing?
I just wish people would realise it rocks and switch from those old MP3s.

As for the music... well, it's DOTT music, so obviously it's cool to listen to! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]What's wrong with Ogg Vorbis, besides the obvious nothing?[hr][/quote]
It's not quite mainstream yet. MP3 on the other hand is more well known and better supported.-----------------------
The end of this post. You may stop reading now.

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
I know, but that's not really Ogg's fault. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]
If "everybody" prefers something inferior over something else, the latter won't have a chance, even if it's much better.
The only way to fix this is for as many people to just stop acting so silly and start using the superior thing to make it more popular.Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
i dunno why but i guess people have to be enlightened about the good thing about ogg.

you will get better sounding for less bytes!!
an ogg encoded in 64kbps will sound like a 128kbps mp3 but still take only the size of a 64kbps mp3...
also ogg is license free if you want to use it for a game ect...

yep i hope the hardware business will scrap the concept
"mp3 players" and turn to "music players" instead. i see no reason to claim on to a format that needs licensing and gives poor sound compared to other formats... a few brave players allready supports it but not the bigger brands.

help us make ogg mainstream!



okay keep ontopic:

title: Re: Remade Day of The Tentacle Soundstracks!!
content:
Oggs and MP3s barely differ in filesize for me. Both are fine (except ogg isn't patented).____________
